comments: pay attention in class and go to office hours if you want to understand the material because the use of the textbook is low to nil. Material in book is rarely used on hw or on the exams. Exams are graded harshly.

One of two professors for this class, the other being Dennis Baldocchi. Whendee doesn\'t use powerpoint so if you miss her lecture you\'re somewhat out of luck. Compared to Dennis, she\'s terse but she\'s not scary or anything like that. He\'s just more relatable. When she\'s not the one giving lecture, she\'ll show up but often leave as soon as possible
Hard grader. No partial points given on exams. And yes, you will hear about Yale. Expected more from her.

At the beginning of the semester she makes it a point to mention she did her degree at Yale.I was rather impressed and expected her to be a really good teacher.But I was definitely disappointed.Specially by choice of content and also because she was unclear as to what was expected on exams or presentations

1) Expects too much for a 3 unit class 2) Tough grader 3) She is very busy and never really available to talk about questions about lecture 4) People who do well are usually those who already took a class with similar subject matter.There\'s no scope for new learners to do well.
She is a really good professor but it\'s difficult to get an A in this class.So take at your own risk.You are expected to know a lot of things beforehand.
